FAQs About Gynecomastia Surgery in Jaipur

As you embark on your gynecomastia journey with Dr. Vishal Purohit’s clinic, it’s natural to have questions. We’ve compiled answers to five commonly asked questions to provide you with clarity and assurance.

Is gynecomastia surgery painful?

Gynecomastia surgery is performed under anesthesia, ensuring a comfortable experience during the procedure. Post-surgery, any discomfort is managed with prescribed pain medications. Our team ensures that your recovery is as smooth and pain-free as possible.

What is the recovery time for gynecomastia surgery?

Recovery times can vary based on individual factors and the extent of the procedure. In general, most patients can resume light activities within a week, gradually transitioning to normal routines within a few weeks. We provide comprehensive aftercare instructions to guide you through each phase of your recovery.

Are the results permanent?

Yes, the results of gynecomastia surgery are typically permanent, provided you maintain a healthy lifestyle. Significant weight fluctuations can impact the long-term outcome, so maintaining a stable weight is recommended to preserve the results achieved through the surgery.

Can gynecomastia recur after surgery?

The chances of gynecomastia recurrence are low, especially when proper surgical techniques are employed. However, it’s important to note that maintaining a stable weight and following post-operative care instructions are crucial to minimizing the risk of recurrence.

Are there non-surgical alternatives for gynecomastia treatment?

Yes, non-surgical alternatives like CoolSculpting can provide minor improvements for individuals with limited gynecomastia concerns. However, for more significant and lasting results, surgical intervention remains the most effective option.
